info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued July 21 at 3:10PM EDT until July 21 at 4:00PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: The National Weather Service in Wakefield has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Southeastern Chesterfield County in central Virginia... The City of Colonial Heights in central Virginia... The City of Hopewell in south central Virginia... The City of Petersburg in south central Virginia... Northwestern Prince George County in south central Virginia... Northeastern Dinwiddie County in south central Virginia... * Until 400 PM EDT. * At 310 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Sutherland, or near Virginia State University, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to vehicles is possible. Expect wind damage to trees and powerlines. * This severe thunderstorm will be near... Virginia State University, Matoaca and Ettrick around 330 PM EDT. Colonial Heights around 335 PM EDT. Petersburg around 340 PM EDT. Fort Lee around 345 PM EDT. Hopewell around 350 PM EDT. Prince George around 355 PM EDT. Jordans Point around 400 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by this severe thunderstorm include New Bohemia, Richard Bland College, Birchett Estate, Addison, Prince George Golf, Jordan Point Country Club and Petersburg National Battlefield. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Please report severe weather by calling 757-899-2415, posting to the NWS Wakefield Facebook page, or using Twitter @NWSWAKEFIELDVA.
